description: Results in a clear brew with nuanced, well-rounded flavor. Brews 1 cup.

steps.title: Prep & Pre-heat
steps.instructions:
1. Boil water in the kettle.
2. Place a V60 filter in the ceramic V60, and place on top of a coffee cup.
3. Pour hot water into the V60 to wet the filter. Discard the water that drips into the cup.

Press 'Next' to continue.

steps.title: Weigh & Grind
steps.instructions:
1. Weigh 10 to 25 grams of coffee. 16 is average.
2. Place coffee cup on scale, with V60 on top.
3. Pour coffee grounds in the V60, and zero out the scale.
4. Enter the grams of coffee you'll brew to the right.

Press 'Next' to continue.

steps.title: Bloom
steps.summary: Pour ${bloomWater} grams of water over grounds.
steps.instructions:
1. Press 'Start Timer', then pour over ${bloomWater} grams of water over the coffee.
2. Start in the center and wet the grounds with water. Once the grounds are wet, wait for 45 seconds. If the grounds are fresh, you may see slight bubbling on top of the grounds occur during this time.

steps.title: Pour Over
steps.instructions:
1. Press 'Start Timer', then continue to pour water over the coffee until you reach ${pourWater} grams of water over the coffee.
2. Concentrate the pour toward the center of the V60, working your way outwards to about a centimeter from the edge of the slurry. The water stream from the pouring kettle shold be slow enough to fall straight down, not at an angle.
3. Once the drips stall to every couple of seconds, your brew is finished.
